subject: Sleep
title: What Is Fragmented Sleep
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is Fragmented Sleep.

hook.text: You slept eight hours but feel like you got four. The total was fine. The structure was shattered.

buildup.text: Fragmented sleep means frequent awakenings that break cycles before they complete their full sequence.

discovery.text: Even brief disruptions reset the cycle, forcing the brain to start over from N1 each time.

twist.text: Studies show fragmented eight-hour sleep can be as impairing as only four hours of continuous sleep.

climax.text: Continuity matters as much as quantity. Unbroken cycles are the currency of restorative sleep.

punchline.text: Eight broken hours can feel worse than four solid ones.

quiz.question: Why is fragmented sleep so impairing?
options: It breaks cycles, forcing the brain to restart from N1
It lowers body temperature too much
